body: @Copilot commented on this pull request. ## Pull request overview This pull request fixes issues with audio conversion to 16kHz for the Whisper large-v3-turbo speech-to-text model. The changes focus on ensuring proper sample rate conversion and improving audio quality through better upsampling algorithms and filter tuning. **Changes:** - Replaced cubic interpolation with sinc-based upsampling (8kHz → 16kHz) with anti-aliasing filter - Simplified and fixed audio preprocessing filters to always convert to 16kHz - Added new `preprocess_audio_bytes` function for in-memory audio processing - Tuned speech detection parameters for better recording quality - Added optional silence frame writing during recording for continuity ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 2 out of 2 changed files in this pull request and generated 8 comments. | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | src/ari/stt.rs | Simplified filter chains, added `preprocess_audio_bytes` for memory-based conversion, removed conditional format checking, always applies 16kHz conversion | | src/ari/rtp.rs | Replaced cubic upsampling with sinc interpolation, added anti-aliasing filter, adjusted speech detection thresholds, added silence frame writing option | --- 💡 Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started. > + // Egyszerűsített filter chain - a túl agresszív filterek rontják a felismerést! + // A Whisper large-v3-turbo robusztus, nem kell sok előfeldolgozás. + let telephony_filter = concat!( + "highpass=f=100:poles=1,", + "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,", + "dynaudnorm=p=0.9:m=10:s=5" + ); The removal of the optimization that checks if audio is already in the correct format (16kHz mono PCM WAV) means that all audio files will now be unnecessarily re-encoded through ffmpeg, even if they're already in the correct format. This adds processing overhead and latency. The previous check using `is_wav_pcm16_mono_16k` was a useful optimization that should be preserved, especially since the function `is_wav_pcm16_mono_16k` is still defined but no longer used. > + // 2. lowpass: Telefonos sávszélesség (300-3400 Hz) + // 3. dynaudnorm: Dinamikus normalizálás a jobb felismeréshez + // FONTOS: Az anlmdn (noise reduction) KIKAPCSOLVA - túl agresszív és torzítja a beszédet! + let telephony_filter = concat!( + "highpass=f=100:poles=1,", + "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,", The comment states "Telefonos sávszélesség (300-3400 Hz)" (telephone bandwidth 300-3400 Hz), but the lowpass filter is set to 3600 Hz, not 3400 Hz. This inconsistency between comment and code should be corrected. Either update the comment to reflect 3600 Hz or adjust the filter to 3400 Hz to match the stated telephony bandwidth standard. > if let Some(state) = recordings.get_mut(&ssrc) { state.silence_frames += 1; + + // FONTOS: A csendes frame-eket is beírjuk, hogy folyamatos legyen az audio + // Ez segít a Whisper-nek jobban értelmezni a beszédet + if WRITE_SILENCE_WHILE_RECORDING && state.silence_frames <= SILENCE_FRAMES_END { + let _ = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples); When writing silence frames during recording (line 409), the error from `write_audio` is silently ignored using `let _ = ...`. However, if writing fails (e.g., disk full, permission issues), the recording will continue without notification, potentially resulting in corrupted audio files. Consider logging write errors or handling them appropriately, especially since successful writes reset `silence_frames` to 0 (line 398), but failed silence writes don't update the counter. ```suggestion if let Err(e) = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples) { eprintln!("[RTP] Error writing silence audio for ssrc {}: {:?}", ssrc, e); } ``` > + for k in -(SINC_TAPS as i32 / 2)..(SINC_TAPS as i32 / 2) { + let idx = i as i32 + k; + if idx >= 0 && (idx as usize) < filtered.len() { + // Distance from interpolation point (0.5) to sample k + let dist = (k as f64) - 0.5; + let w = lanczos(dist, SINC_TAPS as f64 / 2.0); The sinc interpolation distance calculation may produce incorrect results. The loop iterates from `-(SINC_TAPS/2)` to `(SINC_TAPS/2)`, which with SINC_TAPS=8 means k ranges from -4 to 3 (exclusive of 4). For interpolation at position 0.5 between sample i and i+1, the distance should be relative to the interpolation point position. The current calculation `dist = (k as f64) - 0.5` means when k=0 (sample i), dist=-0.5, and when k=1 (sample i+1), dist=0.5, which is correct. However, the kernel width parameter passed to lanczos is `SINC_TAPS/2.0 = 4.0`, but the actual sampling points only extend from -4 to 3, which is asymmetric. Consider using a symmetric range or adjusting the kernel width accordingly. > + let telephony_filter = concat!( + "highpass=f=100:poles=1,", + "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,", + "dynaudnorm=p=0.9:m=10:s=5" + ); The removal of the `STT_TELEPHONY_FILTER` environment variable is a breaking API change. Previously, users could control whether to apply telephony filters via this environment variable, but now filters are always applied unconditionally. If this is intentional, consider either: (1) documenting this breaking change, or (2) keeping the environment variable for backward compatibility while changing the default behavior. > + if let Some(mut stdin) = child.stdin.take() { + stdin.write_all(audio_bytes).await + .map_err(|e| Box::new(e) as Box)?; + drop(stdin); // Close stdin to signal EOF + } In the `preprocess_audio_bytes` function, if `child.stdin` is `None` (line 204), the function continues silently without writing any data to ffmpeg's stdin. This will cause ffmpeg to wait indefinitely for input or fail. Consider returning an error if stdin cannot be obtained, as the audio bytes cannot be processed without it. > + if let Some(mut stdin) = child2.stdin.take() { + stdin.write_all(audio_bytes).await + .map_err(|e| Box::new(e) as Box)?; + drop(stdin); + } Same issue as above: if `child2.stdin` is `None` (line 237), the function continues without writing audio data, which will cause the fallback conversion to fail as well. This should return an error instead of silently continuing. > -const SILENCE_THRESHOLD_NORM: f64 = 0.025; -const SILENCE_FRAMES_END: u32 = 80; -const MIN_RECORDING_DURATION_MS: u64 = 1500; -const SPEECH_START_THRESHOLD: f64 = 0.035; + +// === SPEECH DETECTION PARAMETERS === +// Telefonos audio (8kHz upsampled to 16kHz) sajátosságokhoz hangolva + +// Csend küszöbérték (normalizált RMS, 0.0-1.0) +// 0.015 = alacsonyabb küszöb, érzékenyebb a halk beszédre +// Telefonos vonalakon általában 0.01-0.02 az optimális +const SILENCE_THRESHOLD_NORM: f64 = 0.018; + +// Hány RTP csomagnyi csend után zárjuk le a felvételt +// G.711: 160 sample/csomag @ 8kHz = 20ms/csomag +// 16kHz-re upsamolva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag Typo in comment: "upsamolva" should be "upsamplolva" or "upsample-olva" (upsampled in Hungarian) ```suggestion // 16kHz-re upsample-olva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag ``` -- Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub: https://github.com/Charter-Informatika/ZaraBackend/pull/4#pullrequestreview-3727756678 You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state. html:
@Copilot commented on this pull request.

Pull request overview

This pull request fixes issues with audio conversion to 16kHz for the Whisper large-v3-turbo speech-to-text model. The changes focus on ensuring proper sample rate conversion and improving audio quality through better upsampling algorithms and filter tuning.

Changes:

  • Replaced cubic interpolation with sinc-based upsampling (8kHz → 16kHz) with anti-aliasing filter
  • Simplified and fixed audio preprocessing filters to always convert to 16kHz
  • Added new preprocess_audio_bytes function for in-memory audio processing
  • Tuned speech detection parameters for better recording quality
  • Added optional silence frame writing during recording for continuity

Reviewed changes

Copilot reviewed 2 out of 2 changed files in this pull request and generated 8 comments.

File Description
src/ari/stt.rs Simplified filter chains, added preprocess_audio_bytes for memory-based conversion, removed conditional format checking, always applies 16kHz conversion
src/ari/rtp.rs Replaced cubic upsampling with sinc interpolation, added anti-aliasing filter, adjusted speech detection thresholds, added silence frame writing option

💡 Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started.

In src/ari/stt.rs:

> +    // Egyszerűsített filter chain - a túl agresszív filterek rontják a felismerést!
+    // A Whisper large-v3-turbo robusztus, nem kell sok előfeldolgozás.
+    let telephony_filter = concat!(
+        "highpass=f=100:poles=1,",
+        "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,",
+        "dynaudnorm=p=0.9:m=10:s=5"
+    );

The removal of the optimization that checks if audio is already in the correct format (16kHz mono PCM WAV) means that all audio files will now be unnecessarily re-encoded through ffmpeg, even if they're already in the correct format. This adds processing overhead and latency. The previous check using is_wav_pcm16_mono_16k was a useful optimization that should be preserved, especially since the function is_wav_pcm16_mono_16k is still defined but no longer used.

In src/ari/stt.rs:

> +    // 2. lowpass: Telefonos sávszélesség (300-3400 Hz)
+    // 3. dynaudnorm: Dinamikus normalizálás a jobb felismeréshez
+    // FONTOS: Az anlmdn (noise reduction) KIKAPCSOLVA - túl agresszív és torzítja a beszédet!
+    let telephony_filter = concat!(
+        "highpass=f=100:poles=1,",
+        "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,",

The comment states "Telefonos sávszélesség (300-3400 Hz)" (telephone bandwidth 300-3400 Hz), but the lowpass filter is set to 3600 Hz, not 3400 Hz. This inconsistency between comment and code should be corrected. Either update the comment to reflect 3600 Hz or adjust the filter to 3400 Hz to match the stated telephony bandwidth standard.

In src/ari/rtp.rs:

>              if let Some(state) = recordings.get_mut(&ssrc) {
                 state.silence_frames += 1;
+                
+                // FONTOS: A csendes frame-eket is beírjuk, hogy folyamatos legyen az audio
+                // Ez segít a Whisper-nek jobban értelmezni a beszédet
+                if WRITE_SILENCE_WHILE_RECORDING && state.silence_frames <= SILENCE_FRAMES_END {
+                    let _ = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples);

When writing silence frames during recording (line 409), the error from write_audio is silently ignored using let _ = .... However, if writing fails (e.g., disk full, permission issues), the recording will continue without notification, potentially resulting in corrupted audio files. Consider logging write errors or handling them appropriately, especially since successful writes reset silence_frames to 0 (line 398), but failed silence writes don't update the counter.

⬇️ Suggested change 
-                    let _ = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples);
+                    if let Err(e) = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples) {
+                        eprintln!("[RTP] Error writing silence audio for ssrc {}: {:?}", ssrc, e);
+                    }

In src/ari/rtp.rs:

> +		for k in -(SINC_TAPS as i32 / 2)..(SINC_TAPS as i32 / 2) {
+			let idx = i as i32 + k;
+			if idx >= 0 && (idx as usize) < filtered.len() {
+				// Distance from interpolation point (0.5) to sample k
+				let dist = (k as f64) - 0.5;
+				let w = lanczos(dist, SINC_TAPS as f64 / 2.0);

The sinc interpolation distance calculation may produce incorrect results. The loop iterates from -(SINC_TAPS/2) to (SINC_TAPS/2), which with SINC_TAPS=8 means k ranges from -4 to 3 (exclusive of 4). For interpolation at position 0.5 between sample i and i+1, the distance should be relative to the interpolation point position. The current calculation dist = (k as f64) - 0.5 means when k=0 (sample i), dist=-0.5, and when k=1 (sample i+1), dist=0.5, which is correct. However, the kernel width parameter passed to lanczos is SINC_TAPS/2.0 = 4.0, but the actual sampling points only extend from -4 to 3, which is asymmetric. Consider using a symmetric range or adjusting the kernel width accordingly.

In src/ari/stt.rs:

> +    let telephony_filter = concat!(
+        "highpass=f=100:poles=1,",
+        "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,",
+        "dynaudnorm=p=0.9:m=10:s=5"
+    );

The removal of the STT_TELEPHONY_FILTER environment variable is a breaking API change. Previously, users could control whether to apply telephony filters via this environment variable, but now filters are always applied unconditionally. If this is intentional, consider either: (1) documenting this breaking change, or (2) keeping the environment variable for backward compatibility while changing the default behavior.

In src/ari/stt.rs:

> +    if let Some(mut stdin) = child.stdin.take() {
+        stdin.write_all(audio_bytes).await
+            .map_err(|e| Box::new(e) as Box<dyn Error + Send + Sync>)?;
+        drop(stdin); // Close stdin to signal EOF
+    }

In the preprocess_audio_bytes function, if child.stdin is None (line 204), the function continues silently without writing any data to ffmpeg's stdin. This will cause ffmpeg to wait indefinitely for input or fail. Consider returning an error if stdin cannot be obtained, as the audio bytes cannot be processed without it.

In src/ari/stt.rs:

> +    if let Some(mut stdin) = child2.stdin.take() {
+        stdin.write_all(audio_bytes).await
+            .map_err(|e| Box::new(e) as Box<dyn Error + Send + Sync>)?;
+        drop(stdin);
+    }

Same issue as above: if child2.stdin is None (line 237), the function continues without writing audio data, which will cause the fallback conversion to fail as well. This should return an error instead of silently continuing.

In src/ari/rtp.rs:

> -const SILENCE_THRESHOLD_NORM: f64 = 0.025; 
-const SILENCE_FRAMES_END: u32 = 80; 
-const MIN_RECORDING_DURATION_MS: u64 = 1500;
-const SPEECH_START_THRESHOLD: f64 = 0.035; 
+
+// === SPEECH DETECTION PARAMETERS ===
+// Telefonos audio (8kHz upsampled to 16kHz) sajátosságokhoz hangolva
+
+// Csend küszöbérték (normalizált RMS, 0.0-1.0)
+// 0.015 = alacsonyabb küszöb, érzékenyebb a halk beszédre
+// Telefonos vonalakon általában 0.01-0.02 az optimális
+const SILENCE_THRESHOLD_NORM: f64 = 0.018;
+
+// Hány RTP csomagnyi csend után zárjuk le a felvételt
+// G.711: 160 sample/csomag @ 8kHz = 20ms/csomag
+// 16kHz-re upsamolva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag

Typo in comment: "upsamolva" should be "upsamplolva" or "upsample-olva" (upsampled in Hungarian)

⬇️ Suggested change 
-// 16kHz-re upsamolva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag
+// 16kHz-re upsample-olva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag

text: @Copilot commented on this pull request. ## Pull request overview This pull request fixes issues with audio conversion to 16kHz for the Whisper large-v3-turbo speech-to-text model. The changes focus on ensuring proper sample rate conversion and improving audio quality through better upsampling algorithms and filter tuning. **Changes:** - Replaced cubic interpolation with sinc-based upsampling (8kHz → 16kHz) with anti-aliasing filter - Simplified and fixed audio preprocessing filters to always convert to 16kHz - Added new `preprocess_audio_bytes` function for in-memory audio processing - Tuned speech detection parameters for better recording quality - Added optional silence frame writing during recording for continuity ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 2 out of 2 changed files in this pull request and generated 8 comments. | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | src/ari/stt.rs | Simplified filter chains, added `preprocess_audio_bytes` for memory-based conversion, removed conditional format checking, always applies 16kHz conversion | | src/ari/rtp.rs | Replaced cubic upsampling with sinc interpolation, added anti-aliasing filter, adjusted speech detection thresholds, added silence frame writing option | --- 💡 Add Copilot custom instructions for smarter, more guided reviews. Learn how to get started. > + // Egyszerűsített filter chain - a túl agresszív filterek rontják a felismerést! + // A Whisper large-v3-turbo robusztus, nem kell sok előfeldolgozás. + let telephony_filter = concat!( + "highpass=f=100:poles=1,", + "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,", + "dynaudnorm=p=0.9:m=10:s=5" + ); The removal of the optimization that checks if audio is already in the correct format (16kHz mono PCM WAV) means that all audio files will now be unnecessarily re-encoded through ffmpeg, even if they're already in the correct format. This adds processing overhead and latency. The previous check using `is_wav_pcm16_mono_16k` was a useful optimization that should be preserved, especially since the function `is_wav_pcm16_mono_16k` is still defined but no longer used. > + // 2. lowpass: Telefonos sávszélesség (300-3400 Hz) + // 3. dynaudnorm: Dinamikus normalizálás a jobb felismeréshez + // FONTOS: Az anlmdn (noise reduction) KIKAPCSOLVA - túl agresszív és torzítja a beszédet! + let telephony_filter = concat!( + "highpass=f=100:poles=1,", + "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,", The comment states "Telefonos sávszélesség (300-3400 Hz)" (telephone bandwidth 300-3400 Hz), but the lowpass filter is set to 3600 Hz, not 3400 Hz. This inconsistency between comment and code should be corrected. Either update the comment to reflect 3600 Hz or adjust the filter to 3400 Hz to match the stated telephony bandwidth standard. > if let Some(state) = recordings.get_mut(&ssrc) { state.silence_frames += 1; + + // FONTOS: A csendes frame-eket is beírjuk, hogy folyamatos legyen az audio + // Ez segít a Whisper-nek jobban értelmezni a beszédet + if WRITE_SILENCE_WHILE_RECORDING && state.silence_frames <= SILENCE_FRAMES_END { + let _ = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples); When writing silence frames during recording (line 409), the error from `write_audio` is silently ignored using `let _ = ...`. However, if writing fails (e.g., disk full, permission issues), the recording will continue without notification, potentially resulting in corrupted audio files. Consider logging write errors or handling them appropriately, especially since successful writes reset `silence_frames` to 0 (line 398), but failed silence writes don't update the counter. ```suggestion if let Err(e) = state.write_audio(&decoded_samples) { eprintln!("[RTP] Error writing silence audio for ssrc {}: {:?}", ssrc, e); } ``` > + for k in -(SINC_TAPS as i32 / 2)..(SINC_TAPS as i32 / 2) { + let idx = i as i32 + k; + if idx >= 0 && (idx as usize) < filtered.len() { + // Distance from interpolation point (0.5) to sample k + let dist = (k as f64) - 0.5; + let w = lanczos(dist, SINC_TAPS as f64 / 2.0); The sinc interpolation distance calculation may produce incorrect results. The loop iterates from `-(SINC_TAPS/2)` to `(SINC_TAPS/2)`, which with SINC_TAPS=8 means k ranges from -4 to 3 (exclusive of 4). For interpolation at position 0.5 between sample i and i+1, the distance should be relative to the interpolation point position. The current calculation `dist = (k as f64) - 0.5` means when k=0 (sample i), dist=-0.5, and when k=1 (sample i+1), dist=0.5, which is correct. However, the kernel width parameter passed to lanczos is `SINC_TAPS/2.0 = 4.0`, but the actual sampling points only extend from -4 to 3, which is asymmetric. Consider using a symmetric range or adjusting the kernel width accordingly. > + let telephony_filter = concat!( + "highpass=f=100:poles=1,", + "lowpass=f=3600:poles=1,", + "dynaudnorm=p=0.9:m=10:s=5" + ); The removal of the `STT_TELEPHONY_FILTER` environment variable is a breaking API change. Previously, users could control whether to apply telephony filters via this environment variable, but now filters are always applied unconditionally. If this is intentional, consider either: (1) documenting this breaking change, or (2) keeping the environment variable for backward compatibility while changing the default behavior. > + if let Some(mut stdin) = child.stdin.take() { + stdin.write_all(audio_bytes).await + .map_err(|e| Box::new(e) as Box)?; + drop(stdin); // Close stdin to signal EOF + } In the `preprocess_audio_bytes` function, if `child.stdin` is `None` (line 204), the function continues silently without writing any data to ffmpeg's stdin. This will cause ffmpeg to wait indefinitely for input or fail. Consider returning an error if stdin cannot be obtained, as the audio bytes cannot be processed without it. > + if let Some(mut stdin) = child2.stdin.take() { + stdin.write_all(audio_bytes).await + .map_err(|e| Box::new(e) as Box)?; + drop(stdin); + } Same issue as above: if `child2.stdin` is `None` (line 237), the function continues without writing audio data, which will cause the fallback conversion to fail as well. This should return an error instead of silently continuing. > -const SILENCE_THRESHOLD_NORM: f64 = 0.025; -const SILENCE_FRAMES_END: u32 = 80; -const MIN_RECORDING_DURATION_MS: u64 = 1500; -const SPEECH_START_THRESHOLD: f64 = 0.035; + +// === SPEECH DETECTION PARAMETERS === +// Telefonos audio (8kHz upsampled to 16kHz) sajátosságokhoz hangolva + +// Csend küszöbérték (normalizált RMS, 0.0-1.0) +// 0.015 = alacsonyabb küszöb, érzékenyebb a halk beszédre +// Telefonos vonalakon általában 0.01-0.02 az optimális +const SILENCE_THRESHOLD_NORM: f64 = 0.018; + +// Hány RTP csomagnyi csend után zárjuk le a felvételt +// G.711: 160 sample/csomag @ 8kHz = 20ms/csomag +// 16kHz-re upsamolva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag Typo in comment: "upsamolva" should be "upsamplolva" or "upsample-olva" (upsampled in Hungarian) ```suggestion // 16kHz-re upsample-olva: 320 sample/csomag = 20ms/csomag ``` -- Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub: https://github.com/Charter-Informatika/ZaraBackend/pull/4#pullrequestreview-3727756678 You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.
